snippet.title: D.C. community calendar, April 24-May. 1, 2014
snippet.description: Ears ringing?, Emancipation and Home Rule, Shakespeare birthday, Gilbert and Sullivan auditions.

snippet.title: Watching your sugar intake? Toast to dry wine.
snippet.description: It's not exactly a news flash: More sugar means more calories.

snippet.title: In Venice, learning to row your own boat
snippet.description: A lesson in Venetian rowing through the canals of the watery city.

snippet.title: 21 fresh bars for every occasion
snippet.description: A toast to Washington's fresh batch of bars: Places to sip, snack and celebrate right now.

snippet.title: Gabriel García Márquez, Nobel Prize-winning explorer of myth and reality, dies at 87
snippet.description: Nobel laureate's explorations of myth and reality placed him among the greatest writers of the 20th century.

snippet.title: Philly's 13th St. brings good luck to great food
snippet.description: Tourism officials will tell you the restaurant-rich area at the heart of downtown is called Midtown Village, but that moniker hasn't entirely caught on with the locals.

snippet.title: Oscar winner Paolo Sorrentino to make TV series about a fictional American pope
snippet.description: With Italy's Paolo Sorrentino directing, the series is likely to be controversial.

snippet.title: Vin santo's raisin d'etre
snippet.description: Italian farmers would press the grapes and begin fermentation during Holy Week leading up to the holiday.

snippet.title: D.C. community calendar, April 10 to 17, 2014
snippet.description: Fracking lecture, Cherry Blossom lantern walk, Jeremy Filsell birthday concert, Folger Consort concert.

snippet.title: 'From Pompeii: The Afterlife of a Roman Town,' by Ingrid D. Rowland
snippet.description: A wonderfully digressive revisiting of a doomed city.
